title: Japan vs Scotland, Rugby World Cup 2019 LIVE: Score, stream and latest updates
text:
Follow live updates from the Rugby World Cup as Japan and Scotland go head to head in their Group A finale.

After one super typhoon, the threat of legal action and plenty of heated words, the match was finally given the green light to go ahead on Sunday morning. The winner will progress to the knockout stages, where they’ll face either New Zealand or South Africa in the quarter-finals.

Hosts Japan head into the fixture with a flawless record, having won all three of their group matches. Scotland, meanwhile, were notably thumped by Ireland in their opening match but after back-to-back bonus-point wins, Gregor Townsend’s men now have qualification in their sights. Follow our rolling coverage below:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Teams Japan XV: Tupou; Matsushima; Lafaele, Nakamura; Fukuoka; Tamura; Nagare; Inagaki, Horie, Koo; Thompson, Moore; Leitch, Labuschagne, Himeno.

Scotland XV: Hogg; Seymour, Harris, Johnson, Graham, Russell, Laidlaw; Dell, Brown, Nel, Gilchrist, Gray, Bradbury, Ritchie, Thomson.

Hello all and welcome to The Independent's live coverage of this morning's Rugby World Cup clash between Japan and Scotland.



I'll be bringing you all the live action, reaction and analysis from Yokohama - so make sure to stay tuned!

When is it?

Japan vs Scotland kicks off at 11.45am BST (7.45pm Japan Standard Time) on Sunday 13 October.

Where can I watch it?

ITV1 will be broadcasting the match. Alternatively, you can live stream it via the ITV Hub on your smartphone, laptop or tablet.
